choices.D: Install an updated printer driver on the print server.
choices.B: Reboot all the machines having the issues.
choices.A: Change the language settings on the printers.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the only one that makes sense

" information is garbled and looks like code ". This statement indicates missing and or incorrect print driver. Because only the printers with newly installed firmware had this issue then the driver is a problem for sure. So option D is correct

Selected Answer: D
D. Install an updated printer driver on the print server.

The issue of information being garbled and looking like code could be related to a compatibility issue with the new firmware and the existing printer driver. The printer driver is responsible for converting the print job data into a format that the printer can understand and print. If the new firmware is not compatible with the existing driver, it could cause the printed output to be incorrect.

To resolve this issue, the technician should install an updated printer driver on the print server that is compatible with the new firmware. This will ensure that the driver is able to correctly translate the print job data into a format that the printer can understand and produce accurate printed output.

Selected Answer: D
This was on my exam. I think D should be done before anything gets reset or settings are changed
The word 'next' is throwing me off here. can anybody verify this answer?

questions.question_text: A technician installed new firmware on the company's laser printers and has since been receiving multiple calls that information is garbled and looks like code. Only printers with the new firmware are having this issue. Which of the following steps should the technician complete NEXT?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
802.11n is the standard that supports MIMO (Multiple-Input Multiple-Output) technology. 802.11n is a wireless networking standard that operates on both the 2.4GHz and 5GHz frequency bands, and it uses MIMO technology to increase the data transfer rate and improve signal quality. MIMO technology uses multiple antennas to transmit and receive data, allowing for greater throughput and improved reliability. 802.11a, 802.11b, and 802.11g are earlier wireless networking standards that do not support MIMO technology.

comments.content: I agree with you, I just wanted to point out that earlier Wi-Fi standards, such as 802.11a, 802.11b, and later versions of 802.11g did have provisions for MIMO technology, but with some limitations compared to the later 802.11n standard; Still, 802.11n is often associated with the broader and more advanced implementation of MIMO, allowing for multiple MIMO streams and improved wireless performance. It provides more flexibility in the number of spatial streams and antennas, enabling better performance and support for multiple MIMO streams for higher data rates.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer is D. 802.11n (Wifi 4) supports MIMO (Multiple In Multiple Out) and 802.11 ac and ax ( Wifi 5 and 6) supports MU-MIMO
MIMO = NEMO (n)

comments.content: But the question says that the charging cable is swapped meaning that other charging cables has been used but having the same result of slow charging.
The cables but NOT the charger.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Wall outlets and charging cable has been already tested. The First what I would check is the wattage rating of the charger. Sometimes It happens that the charger might come with the wrong wattage rating which might slow down the charging process. If the wattage rating is correct next option would be B; If the problem still continues then option C; And finally if all of them will not fix an issue the factory reset of the phone. If the issue still exists then the battery is faulty and you need to return it to a vendor.

questions.question_text: A user visits the help desk to report that a smartphone takes more than a day to fully charge. The user already tested multiple wall outlets and swapped the charging cable, but the results are the same. Which of the following should the technician do FIRST?

choices.D: Complete a factory reset of the phone.
choices.C: Check that all missing smartphone OS updates are applied.
choices.A: Verify the power rating of the charger.
choices.B: Ensure all unnecessary connectivity features are disabled.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
The right answer is E.

Selected Answer: E
Because the files of the application that did not work were different than those on the other computers means that could come from another source and the application did not work. Attempting to reinstall does not make sense if the app did not work. The only logical answer for me is to determine the source that could be not legitimate or corrupt. I would run these files with Virus Total scan: https:// www.virustotal.com
I think that I should check the source from which the program was downloaded since in the question it indicates that the files are different from those of other PCs that contain the same program.
had this one on my exam, whats the answer?

questions.question_text: User attempted to install an application on a desktop, and the installation attempt failed. Technician compares these installation files to those on another user's machine and finds the files are different. Which of the following should the technician do NEXT?

choices.E: Determine the source of the installation file.
choices.C: Test the functionality of the antivirus.

questions.question_text: A technician responds to a help desk ticket that indicates a user's workstation is not booting. The technician initially suspects a failed hard drive. The technician performs diagnostics and confirms the hard drive is fully operational. Which of the following steps should the technician complete NEXT?

choices.D: Consider another possible cause of the issue.
choices.C: Report the status of the drive and close the ticket.
choices.E: Restore the latest backup of the system.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Wouldn't the next step be to take a step back and consider other issues?

Selected Answer: D
If the first theory was wrong then ya got to try again.

Selected Answer: D
The technician established the theory of probable cause and tested it and did not confirm - the hard drive worked. So now he needs to re-establish a new theory or escalate a problem.
" 3. Test the theory to determine the cause:
Once the theory is confirmed, determine the next steps to resolve the problem.
If the theory is not confirmed, re-establish a new theory or escalate." Learn CertMaster CompTIA
